intro: Thymophylla setifolia var. radiata, commonly known as the radiate thymophylla, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is known for its aromatic foliage. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in desert or semi-desert environments. Its unique floral structure and medicinal properties have made it of interest to botanists and herbalists alike.
